{{cpp/ranges/drop_while_view/title|begin}}
{{cpp/ranges/drop_while_view/navbar}}

{{ddcl|since=c++20|
constexpr auto begin();
}}

Returns an iterator to the first element of the view.

Effectively returns {{c|ranges::find_if_not(base_, std::cref(pred()))}}, where {{rlpi|/#Data members|base_}} is the underlying view. The behavior is undefined if {{c|*this}} does not store a predicate.

In order to provide the amortized constant time complexity required by the {{lconcept|range}} concept, this function caches the result within the {{tt|drop_while_view}} object for use on subsequent calls.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
Iterator to the first element of the view.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cassert&gt;
#include &lt;ranges&gt;
 
int main()
{
    static constexpr auto data = {0, -1, -2, 3, 1, 4, 1, 5};
    auto view = std::ranges::drop_while_view{data, [](int x){ return x &lt;= 0; }&lt;!----&gt;};
    assert(view.begin()[0] == 3);
}
}}
